oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Riderless Horse" monument at Chickamauga Battlefield Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Horses; Parks
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.); Equestrian Statues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stone monument of a riderless horse at Chickamauga Battlefield Park near Chattanooga, Tennessee. Carving on monument reads, "First Wisconsin Cavalry, 2nd Brig. 1st Div. Cavalry Corps."; Descriptive text on the reverse side of postcard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Granite monument, erected in 1894, commemorates the 2nd Brigade of the 1st Division of the 1st Wisconsin Cavalry Corps, mustered into service March 8, 1862.; They saw action in Arkansas; Kentucky; Georgia; Alabama; Nashville, Tennessee; St. Louis and Cape Girardeau, Missoui; and were part of the pursuit of Jefferson Davis.
